author: archyde
title: Finances News Hebdo: Unwavering Commitment to Authentic Journalism in 2024 - Archyde
text: 2023-12-28 19:02:45 L‚Äôyear is coming to an end. The last pages of 2023 are inevitably ticking away, to close this chapter rich in news, challenges and successes. This Thursday, December 28 marks the release of our final issue of the year; an edition which, like those that preceded it, embodies our unwavering commitment to journalistic excellence. At this time when the end-of-year festivities resonate across the world, allow us to take a moment to express to you, dear readers, our deep gratitude for your loyalty and support throughout these months. Your trust is the pillar on which every word, every analysis, every article we have shared rests. Finances News Hebdo has always stood out for its commitment to the rigor of information. In this era where the media landscape is increasingly parasitized by fake news, we have maintained our course, trying to offer our readers a reliable compass in the tumult of the news. The incessant quest for truth, the tireless search for objectivity, this is what defines our journalistic approach. Finances News Hebdo is an integral part of the JMA Conseil Group, a publisher that has helped shape the media landscape for a quarter of a century. These 25 years of dedication, insight and innovation have forged an indelible mark on the world of press and media. It is with a feeling of pride that we have traveled this path, hand in hand with our readers, advertisers, partners‚Ä¶ thus contributing to providing the right information and fueling debate. And we intend to continue in this direction. This is why, in 2024, the JMA Conseil Group plans to break new ground. Innovative projects will see the light of day, thus underlining our commitment to the development of the press and media sector. At the dawn of this new year, we would like to thank you once again for your unwavering trust. We will continue to uncover hidden truths and share with you this passion for authentic information. Happy New Year 2024! By FZ Ouriaghli 1703808789 #TRUTH

author: Gustavo M√°rquez
title: Le dej√≥ $7 mil millones a Am√©rica, brilla en Argentina y busca su debut con la selecci√≥n Colombia
text:
En diciembre de 2023, Juan Camilo Portilla se convirti√≥ en la mina de oro de Am√©rica de Cali despu√©s de firmar su paso al f√∫tbol argentino. El mediocampista fue vendido por 1,8 millones de euros (7,6 mil millones de pesos) a Talleres de C√≥rdoba y se convirti√≥ en un cafetero m√°s en conquistar la tierra de Lionel Messi. Tras sus buenas actuaciones en los diablos rojos, se esperaba que en el equipo de la "T" tambi√©n fuera importante; y sin decepcionar, ha logrado hacerse con la titular y brillar a tal nivel que fue convocado por N√©stor Lorenzo para hacer parte de la selecci√≥n Colombia, equipo con el que nunca ha jugado.
üìù ùêÇùê®ùêßùêØùê®ùêúùêöùê≠ùê®ùê´ùê¢ùêö ùêÖùêûùêúùê°ùêö ùêÖùêàùêÖùêÄ ùêíùêûùê•ùêûùêúùêúùê¢ùê®ÃÅùêß ùêÇùê®ùê•ùê®ùê¶ùêõùê¢ùêö ùêùùêû ùêåùêöùê≤ùê®ùê´ùêûùê¨‚Äî Selecci√≥n Colombia (@FCFSeleccionCol)
Ellos son los elegidos por N√©stor Lorenzo para enfrentar a üá™üá∏ y üá∑üá¥ el 22 y 26 de marzo.
üîó
 [#TodosSomosColombia]üá®üá¥ [pic.twitter.com/1ib9VqWWUP] [March 14, 2024]
| Vea tambi√©n:
Se le adelantaron a N√©stor Lorenzo: El juvenil colombiano que juega en el Real y fue convocado por Espa√±a
Y es que, aunque esta no es la primera convocatoria de Juan Camilo Portilla al equipo nacional, pues a inicios de 2023 fue llamado tambi√©n por N√©stor Lorenzo para hacer parte de la plantilla que disput√≥ el amistoso contra Estados Unidos en Los √Ångeles, California, el joven jugador no ha tenido minutos dentro de la cancha vestido de amarillo, pues en ese compromiso no ingres√≥ al terreno de juego. Es por eso que estos partidos contra Espa√±a y Rumania podr√≠an ser decisivos para su debut en la tricolor, pues su buen momento lo hace merecedor de estar en el terreno de juego.
Los n√∫meros con los que llega Juan Camilo Portilla a la selecci√≥n Colombia
Hay que recordar que los n√∫meros del mediocampista nacido en Santiago de Cali han sido muy buenos en 2024. En Talleres ha disputado 10 partidos, todos como titular, y ya suma 4 asistencias y 1 gol. Su incidencia en el f√∫tbol del equipo argentino ha sido tan evidente, que desde tierras gauchas ya lo inclinan como un jugador que est√° alistando las maletas para irse al f√∫tbol europeo, as√≠ como lo hicieron algunos de sus compatriotas como Radamel Falcao Garc√≠a o James Rodr√≠guez.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Hearts at Home Continues Its Dedication to Providing Premier In-Home Care in Oklahoma City | User | times-online.com
text:
Hearts at Home reaffirms its commitment to providing premier in-home elderly care in Oklahoma City, emphasizing personalized, compassionate services for a fulfilling life. As a trusted provider, they offer comprehensive care, ensuring seniors' well-being and family peace of mind. Discover more about their dedication to enhancing lives at https://heartsathomeok.com. Oklahoma City, OK - Hearts at Home, a distinguished provider of in-home care services, today reaffirmed its commitment to the community of Oklahoma City by continuing to offer exceptional elderly care. Recognizing the importance of accessible in-home care for families, Hearts at Home emphasizes its dedication to ensuring the well-being of loved ones through personalized and compassionate care services.
"At Hearts at Home, we understand the value of family and the need for quality elderly care in Oklahoma City. Our mission is to provide comprehensive in-home care services that cater to the unique needs of each individual, ensuring they receive the care and support necessary for a fulfilling life," stated Marcia Crook, owner of Hearts at Home. "We are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients and their families by maintaining our status as a trusted provider of elderly care in Oklahoma City."
Hearts at Home's approach to in-home care is centered around a deep understanding of the needs of the elderly and their families. By offering a wide range of services, including personal care, medication management, mobility assistance, and companionship, Hearts at Home ensures that families have the support they need to care for their elderly loved ones at home. This commitment highlights the agency's role in facilitating accessible, high-quality elderly care in Oklahoma City.
As the demand for reliable in-home care continues to grow, Hearts at Home's dedication to meeting this need underscores its pledge to the community. By prioritizing its clients' health, happiness, and well-being, Hearts at Home stands as a pillar of support for families across Oklahoma City, offering peace of mind and a higher quality of life for the elderly.
For more information about Hearts at Home and their In-Home Care in Oklahoma City, OK , please visit their website at https://heartsathomeok.com
About Hearts at Home:
Hearts at Home is a leading provider of in-home care services in Oklahoma City, OK. Known for its commitment to quality, compassion, and excellence, Hearts at Home prides itself on its ability to offer personalized, compassionate care that prioritizes the well-being of its clients. As a trusted provider of elderly care in Oklahoma City, Hearts at Home is dedicated to enhancing the lives of seniors and their families, ensuring they receive the dignity, respect, and quality of care they deserve.
Media Contact
Company Name: Hearts at Home Companion Care
Contact Person: Marcia Crook
Email: Send Email
Phone: (405) 310-4000
Address: 1400 N Porter Ave
City: Norman
State: OK
Country: United States

author: kapirey
title: AB9 - ABO Wind AG will capitalize on Europe's green transition with projected ‚Ç¨50 million profit by 2027
text:
Last Update28 Jul 25
The recent tariff agreements between the United States and the European Union, signed on July 28, 2025, could have indirect implications for companies like ABO Wind, although the company is not specifically mentioned in the current reports. Here's how they might affect you:
üîç Tariff Agreement Summary A general tariff of 15% has been established for most European products exported to the US, thus avoiding a 30% tariff that had been initially proposed The agreement includes "zero tariffs" on strategic products, such as some agricultural, chemical, aeronautics, and semiconductor products The EU pledges to buy $750 billion worth of U.S. energy and invest another $600 billion in the U.S., which could affect the energy and trade balance
üåç Potential impact on ABO Wind ABO Wind is a German company specialized in the development of renewable energy projects, mainly in Europe and Latin America. Although it has not been directly mentioned in connection with this agreement, there are several factors to consider:
- Energy competition: Europe's commitment to buy large volumes of U.S. energy could reduce demand for local renewable projects if some of that energy comes from non-renewable sources or if imports are prioritized over domestic development.
- Export costs: If ABO Wind exports components or services to the U.S., the new 15% tariff could make its operations in that market more expensive, although it is unclear whether its products are included in the list of zero-tariff exceptions.
- Stock market: European stock markets have reacted with slight increases after the agreement, indicating a perception of stability. However, specific actions such as those of ABO Wind (AB9. F) have not shown any notable movements related to this issue in recent days.
- Opportunities in Latin America: ABO Wind continues to expand in markets such as Colombia, where it recently signed a deal for a 19.9 MW solar park This suggests that its international strategy could be more focused on regions outside the EU-US axis. This partially protects it from these agreements.
üîç 1. Overview of ABO Wind AG
ABO Wind AG is a German company specializing in the development of renewable energy projects, primarily wind and solar. Founded in 1996, it operates in over 16 countries and has developed more than 3,600 MW of renewable capacity. Its business model covers everything from planning to construction and operation of energy parks.
üìä Financial Situation and Outlook
- In 2024, ABO Wind reported a net profit of ‚Ç¨25.6 million, the second-highest in its history.
- For 2025, the company projects profits between ‚Ç¨29 and ‚Ç¨39 million, with expectations to reach ‚Ç¨50 million annually starting in 2027.
- The stock has shown strong performance in 2025, hitting a new 6-month high and maintaining a clear upward trend.
üåç Benefit from European and German Aid
‚úÖ 1. Subsidies and Guaranteed Tariffs (EEG)
- ABO Wind benefits from Germany‚Äôs regulated tariff system (EEG), which guarantees a minimum price per kWh generated. In 2025, it won tenders for over 120 MW in wind projects, with average tariffs of 6.83 cents/kWh.
- These tariffs have been state-funded since 2022, reducing financial risk for developers like ABO Wind.
‚úÖ 2. Favorable European Regulation
- The EU has accelerated permitting for renewable projects under the REPowerEU plan, allowing ABO Wind to submit over 850 MW in applications in the first half of 2025 alone.
- The end of the EU‚Äôs emergency regulation created a ‚Äúrush‚Äù in applications, which ABO Wind has capitalized on with an aggressive expansion strategy.
‚úÖ 3. Next Generation EU Funds
- While not explicitly mentioned in ABO Wind‚Äôs reports, the Recovery and Resilience Facility (RRF) funded by Next Generation EU supports innovative renewable and storage projects.
- ABO Wind, with operations in Europe: Germany (headquarters), Spain, France, Finland, Ireland, Greece, Poland, Hungary, Netherlands, also United Kingdom, America: Argentina, Colombia, Canada, Africa: Tunisia, South Africa, Tanzania, could benefit indirectly through partnerships or project sales, as it has already done with Endesa.
- Also United Kingdom, America: Argentina, Colombia, Canada, Africa: Tunisia, South Africa, Tanzania.
üß† Fundamental Analysis
IndicatorValue / CommentRevenue 2024~‚Ç¨200M (estimated from project growth)Net Profit 2024‚Ç¨25.6MProfit Forecast 2025‚Ç¨29‚Äì39MEstimated P/E RatioModerate, with growth potentialDebtControlled, many projects self-financedExpected GrowthHigh, driven by tenders and international expansionCompetitive AdvantageExperience, geographic diversification, vertical integration
üìà Conclusion
ABO Wind AG is in a strong position to capitalize on Europe‚Äôs energy transition momentum. Government and EU subsidies, along with a favorable regulatory environment and an expanding project pipeline, reinforce its profile as a sustainable growth stock in the renewable energy sector.
How well do narratives help inform your perspective?

The narrative does not reflect the opinions of Simply Wall St, and the views expressed are the opinion of the author alone, acting on their own behalf. These scenarios are not indicative of the company's future performance and are exploratory in the ideas they cover. The fair value estimates are estimations only, and does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and they do not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. author: Adam Pogrund
title: Christmas shopping fears after brutal storm shuts down ferry route
text:
Retailers are scrambling to get goods into the country as the crucial ferry route from Holyhead to Dublin has been closed for five days due to damage caused by Storm Darragh.
Just two weeks before Christmas, hauliers have warned that ‚Äòdisastrous‚Äô backlogs will cause serious disruptions to trade and prevent people receiving some deliveries in time.
Ger Hyland, president of the Irish Road Haulage Association (IRHA) , said: ‚ÄòPeople are expecting items to be delivered for December 25 that won‚Äôt arrive on time and shops won‚Äôt get stock.
‚ÄòAs an industry, we‚Äôre used to delays of a day or two. But this is unique. A five-day supply line being cut the week before Christmas will have a devastating impact. Our trailers are sitting on the far side of the Irish Sea.‚Äô
While a limited service is expected to resume later this evening, Mr Hyland pointed out that the route was expected to reopen by Monday, and every day since. Photographer: Patrick Bolger/Bloomberg via Getty Images While a limited service is expected to resume later this evening, Mr Hyland pointed out that the route was expected to reopen by Monday, and every day since. ‚ÄòBut I don‚Äôt know when now,‚Äô he added. ‚ÄòLots of Christmas stuff is being held up: clothes, fragrances, foodstuffs.‚Äô
He said that a backlog normally takes three to four days to clear after two days of disruption, but this is now being compounded by other issues.
Mr Hyland remarked: ‚ÄòWe have a driver shortage. Around 20% of our drivers will be heading off back to Eastern Europe for Christmas at the end of the week.‚Äô
Darren Murphy, managing director of BM Transport, a haulage company based in Co. Monaghan, said: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a disaster. Usually we have 100 trailers a day on the Holyhead [in Wales] to Dublin route.(Photo by PAUL ELLIS/AFP via Getty Images) He said trucks will be ‚Äògoing via Liverpool, Pembroke and Northern Ireland but boats are wedged‚Äô, adding: ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs just not enough capacity. Trailers will be sent wherever we can get a booking.‚Äô
Darren Murphy, managing director of BM Transport , a haulage company based in Co. Monaghan, said: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a disaster. Usually we have 100 trailers a day on the Holyhead [in Wales] to Dublin route. There‚Äôs a major backlog of trailers out of service. I have 85 to 100 sitting in Holyhead waiting to go. There‚Äôs been 85 sitting there since 1am on Sunday waiting to go. Since Monday I‚Äôve been trying to take them to other ports.
Retailers are scrambling to get goods into the country as the crucial ferry route from Holyhead to Dublin has been closed for five days due to damage caused by Storm Darragh. ‚ÄòI have ten drivers stuck in Holyhead who I have no work for. It‚Äôs getting compounded every day. We carry stock for major supermarkets. Stuff which was supposed to be delivered on Monday won‚Äôt be seen until next week. It will become a bigger issue next week when people are low on stock.‚Äô
Hauliers have been forced to use alternative ports but are also facing capacity issues at those places. Rosslare Europort, which was ‚Äòworking at capacity prior‚Äô, said Mr Hyland, ‚Äòis completely blocked up with trade at the moment‚Äô.
A general view shows Irish ferries ro-ro ferry Ulysses unloads as Stena Adventurer arrives in Holyhead port in Anglesey, north Wales on January 02, 2021. (Photo by PAUL ELLIS/AFP via Getty Images) Mr Murphy added: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs hard to find ways around it. It‚Äôs not physically possible. You‚Äôve got Pembroke, Liverpool, Coleraine, Heysham [as alternative routes], but because of Brexit there are customs delays when you put foodstuffs and plants through to Ireland. In Liverpool, the port is overrun. Usually you can load your trailers on ferries days in advance, but because there is physically no space, you can‚Äôt drop them until 12 hours in advance.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs slow going via Coleraine. It takes a day and a half to ship to Belfast and then to Ireland.‚Äô
Jean McCabe, CEO of Retail Excellence Ireland, said: ‚ÄòAny disruption to logistics has the potential to have a knock-on effect on product availability in stores. A majority of retailers would be well stocked up already in the run into Christmas but it does mean some products could be out of stock as they struggle to replenish from UK fulfilment bases. The timing around Christmas isn‚Äôt ideal but retailers are finding other routes, for example through the port at Liverpool.‚Äô
A truck at the check-in area of the Port of Holyhead in Anglesey, UK, on Friday, April 29, 2022. Anglesey is where the government‚Äôs new energy strategy and its economic vision meet, but some locals are skeptical. Photographer: Francesca Jones/Bloomberg via Getty Images The Holyhead-to-Dublin route, operated by Irish Ferries and Stena Line, has remained closed in both directions since the Welsh port‚Äôs infrastructure was damaged by Storm Darragh on Saturday.
A spokesperson for Holyhead port originally said it was expected to reopen at 6pm on Tuesday, but all eight of yesterday‚Äôs Irish Ferries sailings from the port to Dublin were cancelled, as were the six in the other direction. Holyhead is set to reopen at 5.15pm today, although with significantly reduced capacity.
The IRHA criticised outgoing Minister of Transport Eamon Ryan for being ‚Äònowhere to be seen‚Äô when Irish trade routes are ‚Äòfacing severe challenges‚Äô and called on Taoiseach Simon Harris to assume responsibility for the Department of Transport. It said there has been ‚Äòno emergency planning obvious following weekend travel disruption‚Äô.
Mr Hyland said the storm damage has exposed ‚Äòa serious vulnerability on Irish trade, cross-Channel trade routes‚Äô, adding: ‚ÄòThis has been compounded by the complete silence on the issue from the outgoing Minister for Transport Eamon Ryan.
‚ÄòWe need someone in charge of the Department of Transport who is engaged, active and accountable. As an island nation these things need to be planned.‚Äô
A spokesperson at the Department of Transport said: ‚ÄòSince the difficulties first arose in Holyhead port, the department has been in constant contact with Dublin Port to monitor the situation and to liaise on contingency planning to avoid/reduce the possibility of congestion arising in the port or surrounding transport routes.
Holyhead port‚Äôs closure has also impacted An Post ahead of Christmas, but not as significantly, as ‚Äòmuch of its parcel traffic comes by air freight‚Äô, a spokesperson said. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty Images) ‚ÄòThe department is also engaging with the Irish Road Haulage Association and the Irish Exporters Association. The minister has been kept informed about the situation throughout. The minister would like to underline his appreciation for the flexibility and resilience shown by the maritime and haulage sectors during this challenging period.‚Äô
Holyhead port‚Äôs closure has also impacted An Post ahead of Christmas, but not as significantly, as ‚Äòmuch of its parcel traffic comes by air freight‚Äô, a spokesperson said.
A spokesman for Dublin Port said it remains operational and has not experienced freight congestion, adding: ‚ÄòWe are working closely with the operators to prepare for the resumption of Holyhead services.‚Äô
Around 90% of Ireland‚Äôs internationally traded goods are transported by sea, according to the Irish Maritime Development Office . Last year, 113,164 trade vehicles were transported through Dublin Port.

author: @TUDNUSA
title: Uriel Antuna le va a hacer falta a Cruz Azul, opina √ìscar Conejo P√©rez | TUDN Liga MX | TUDN
text: [Liga MX](https://www.univision.com/temas/liga-mx) Uriel Antuna le va a hacer falta a Cruz Azul, se√±ala Conejo P√©rez Oscar P√©rez habl√≥ de la decisi√≥n del jugador de irse a Tigres y asegur√≥ que ‚Äúhoy los chicos apuntan no tanto a lo deportivo‚Äù, sino a lo econ√≥mico. Oscar 'Conejo' P√©rez, todo un referente del arco de Cruz Azul y de la Selecci√≥n Mexicana, asegur√≥ [que a Uriel Antuna, que recientemente dej√≥ La M√°quina para irse con Tigres, le har√° falta el equipo celeste. ](https://www.tudn.com/futbol/liga-mx/oficial-tigres-da-bienvenida-uriel-antuna-para-apertura-2024-liga-mx) El arquero de M√©xico en los Mundiaes de Corea Jap√≥n 2002 y Sud√°frica 2010, estuvo en el programa Faitelson Sin Censura del periodista David Faitelson, de TUDN, y ah√≠ expres√≥ sus ideas sobre Antuna. "(Es) buen profesional, buen chavo, bastante bien Uriel. Tom√≥ su decisi√≥n de moverse y nada, creo que le va a hacer falta Cruz Azul", se√±al√≥. Girando sobre el mismo tema, P√©rez piensa que el d√≠a de hoy, los futbolistas apuntan no tanto a lo deportivo sino a lo econ√≥mico a la hora de contratarse. "Antes estaba el pacto de caballeros y te quejabas, ¬øno? Hoy tenemos esa posibilidad y nos vamos para el otro lado. Yo creo que s√≠ debe haber un equilibrio en esa parte y hoy los chicos apuntan no tanto a lo deportivo, sino a otras cosas", expres√≥. Incluso 'Conejo' record√≥ una ocasi√≥n, cuando √©l era parte del cuerpo t√©cnico de Cruz Azul, en la que le lleg√≥ a Uriel una oferta de Europa, pero no era favorable para nadie y no se fue. "Uriel tom√≥ su decisi√≥n. Cuando yo estuve, ten√≠a una oferta para ir al extranjero, las condiciones no eran favorables para √©l ni para el club, en ese momento. √âl incluso se qued√≥ un poco inc√≥modo porque no se le hab√≠a dado la oportunidad", coment√≥. "Era de Grecia, creo era el Panathinaikos. No, era ver si √©l rend√≠a cuenta en seis meses, o si sal√≠a, iban a Champions, se quedaban con √©l o sino, se regresaba", finaliz√≥.
